author: iSazonov
body:
## PR Summary
Related #6874 
1. Remove unused files.
2. Clean up #if SILVERLIGHT

## PR Checklist

- [x] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [x] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] [Change is not breaking](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)
- [x] [Make sure all `.h`, `.cpp`, `.cs`, `.ps1` and `.psm1` files have the correct copyright header](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` to the beginning of the title and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.
- **User-facing changes**
    - [x] Not Applicable
    - **OR**
    - [ ] User-facing [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
        - [ ] Issue filed - Issue link:
- **Testing - New and feature**
    - [x] Not Applicable or can only be tested interactively
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)
        - [x] [Add `[feature]` if the change is significant or affects feature tests](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/testing-guidelines.md#requesting-additional-tests-for-a-pr)

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
Did you build the `libpsl-native` after changing this? CI build doesn't build it as we pull the existing package. Do a search with the method name or file name, you will find more references to them.

```
[C:\PowerShell]
PS:17> dir * -Recurse | sls -SimpleMatch 'GetComputerName()'

src\libpsl-native\src\getcomputername.cpp:17:char* GetComputerName()
src\libpsl-native\src\getcomputername.h:10:char *GetComputerName();
src\libpsl-native\src\getfullyqualifiedname.cpp:21:    char *computerName = GetComputerName();
src\libpsl-native\test\test-getcomputername.cpp:33:    ASSERT_STREQ(GetComputerName(), expectedComputerName);
src\libpsl-native\test\test-getfullyqualifiedname.cpp:16:    char *hostname = GetComputerName();


[C:\PowerShell]
PS:18> dir * -Recurse | sls -SimpleMatch 'GetCurrentProcessId()'

src\libpsl-native\src\getcurrentprocessorid.cpp:8:pid_t GetCurrentProcessId()
src\libpsl-native\src\getcurrentprocessorid.h:11:pid_t GetCurrentProcessId();
src\libpsl-native\test\test-getcurrentprocessid.cpp:10: const int32_t currentProcessId = GetCurrentProcessId();
src\libpsl-native\test\googletest\src\gtest-death-test.cc:723:      StreamableToString(static_cast<unsigned
int>(::GetCurrentProcessId())) +


[C:\PowerShell]
PS:19> dir * -Recurse | sls -SimpleMatch 'GetComputerName.cpp'

src\libpsl-native\src\CMakeLists.txt:12:  getcomputername.cpp
src\libpsl-native\test\CMakeLists.txt:9:  test-getcomputername.cpp


[C:\PowerShell]
PS:20> dir * -Recurse | sls -SimpleMatch 'GetCurrentProcessId.cpp'

src\libpsl-native\test\CMakeLists.txt:7:  test-getcurrentprocessid.cpp


[C:\PowerShell]
PS:21> v .\src\libpsl-native\src\CMakeLists.txt
[C:\PowerShell]
PS:22>
[C:\PowerShell]
PS:22> dir * -Recurse | sls -SimpleMatch 'getcurrentprocessorid.cpp'

src\libpsl-native\src\CMakeLists.txt:10:  getcurrentprocessorid.cpp
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @daxian-dbw I've collected a few commits, all of which are in different places in code. I tried to split this into a few small PR but it seems I started in the wrong direction. I guess the right direction is to clean C# code and then clean and republish the psl package.

title: Cleanup unused code in psl-native
